Dialog.text: These... "psych evals" are a waste of time.
That was different.
Those files were supposed to be closed.
I'm getting there.

Dialog.notes: Flat refusal. I don't want to talk abou it.

Dialog.text: She's a Sanitation Boss. And we're not in a relationship.
Dialog.notes: Defensive. Emphasis on NOT.

Dialog.text: Not anymore.
Dialog.notes: A little to herself.

Dialog.text: Screw this. I'm done. Report me to the Yu's, I don't care. They're putting the station at risk, just like TranStar North, and just like on Earthside.
What the hell did you do to that thing, Mitchell? It sounds like an Auntie Waffle commercial.
Of course. Also, stop crawling under my desk like a crazy person, Crazy.
Dialog.notes: Beat before the last "crazy", using it like a name.

Dialog.text: Have to. Wrapping up some things in Deep Storage, lot of data coming through the system lately.
Dialog.notes: Unhappy but obligated tone.

Dialog.text: I can't be having this conversation.
Dialog.notes: Spikes, false alarmed voice

Dialog.text: I'm going to lose my job for even talking to you about this.
Dialog.notes: Playing at being worried

Dialog.text: What - exactly. What you're going to do is have dinner with me.
Dialog.notes: (Abigail Foy) Brings it home

Dialog.text: You say what a lot when you should say "yes."
See, all settled. Don't worry about the TranScribes, it's not against regulation. So are you going to invite me to this game or not?
Dialog.notes: Pause before the last line. You can hear her grinning.

Dialog.text: What are you doing? Are you recording this?
They are not.
"Future Us"? We are not calling ourselves that.
And this is the reward I get.
I'm trying to reach Abby, but she's not answering.

Dialog.notes: Very concerned. Was too concerned about Abby until this point to realize something was amiss.

Dialog.text: Emma? I can barely hear you.
Is Abby with you? Are you ok?
Had a "meeting" with the great Alex Yu today. He gave me one of his bullshit "I'm sorries" with no resolution. Between him and Morgan it's like a tradition. The Yu family "sorry."
Did you just compare me to him? To that arrogant sack of shit?
Dialog.notes: She lets each of the last words hit like a hammer.

Dialog.text: You're right. Get out, we're done.
Dialog.notes: (Abigail Foy) beat before this line

Dialog.text: I said get out.
Dialog.notes: (Abigail Foy) ruthless, cold

Dialog.text: If things get bad, I'll jettison a data vault and spacewalk along the hull. Come to Morgan's room in the executive suites and bang on the window. I should feel the vibration.

Dialog.notes: Surprise, Morgan is the last person she expected to see.

Dialog.text: I thought they'd demoted you, sent you Earthside.
(O2 Warning) Dammit.
Dialog.notes: Takes a sudden inhale, alert SFX of O2 dying goes off, and she hisses quietly to herself as alarms go off

Dialog.text: Try the kitchen. Did you try the kitchen?
Morgan, there's not much time. Please.
If you have any tricks up your sleeve, Morgan, now's the time.
His signature's left the crew quarters.
He got away from you. Or did you let him go?
Dialog.notes: She pauses in between, cold

Dialog.text: No more time, Morgan. Seeing spots at this point. Looks like neither of us get what we want.
You got him. Thank you, Morgan. You pulled it off.
Dialog.notes: Grudging respect, last part as if she wasn't sure he could.

Dialog.text: I'm also transmitting your brother's password and Dr. Igwe's. You might find somethign you can use.
Goodbye, Morgan.
You had him. You had him right in front of you and you couldn't go through with it!
Killing him won't fix anything. Everything's screwed up. I guess the least I can do is try to help you sweep up what's left.
Dialog.notes: sighing, realizing she's lost control

Dialog.text: Hey, Kevin. I'm just checking in to see if you've seen Abby. I know you two were just hanging out. Message me if you get this.
Emma. It's Danielle.
-no, this sounded serious, so I wanted to shut my TranScribe off. So okay, so you're asking me if it's okay to record...
On the TranScribes.
Abby - I'm still in Deep Storage. I don't know why you won't pick up. I hope you're safe.
Dialog.notes: Danielle is worried, is leaving a "voice mail" for Abby

Dialog.text: So - I hear your words. Sense some judgment. Trying to pay attention.
Dialog.notes: Dismissive, slightly sarcastic, mimicking her tone

Dialog.text: But instead, you're telling me this to one, protect me, and two, teach me not be a hypocrite about password protocol, which leads to three, you want me to be a better person. Four? That is why I love you.
Dialog.notes: Countering the previous line from Abigail. Emphasis on the word "that".

Dialog.text: I could take on the role of Morgan.
Dialog.notes: Barreling ahead

Dialog.text: "Shift's over when the sun sets on Talos."
Dialog.notes: Mocking female Morgan's voice

Dialog.text: "Shift's over when the sun sets on Talos."
Dialog.notes: Mocking male Morgan's voice

Dialog.text: As if it ever does. What a joker.
And Abby - please don't take any chances, all right? I... Be safe.
Dialog.notes: Starts to say "I love you" but can't say that.

Dialog.text: His tracking signature makes no sense, though. Might be one of those "Volunteers" you and your brother were cycling up here.
Dialog.notes: Bitter in the last half. Blames Morgan for Abby's death indirectly.

Dialog.text: Make sure he doesn't get out. I'll see what I can do to help you from out here. (O2 Warning) But do it quick, I don't have much time.
Dialog.notes: Beat before "do it". O2 sfx before "but do it quick". She's running out of time.

Dialog.text: ...wait. You already found him?
Dialog.notes: just noticing the body that Morgan has brought in.

Dialog.text: I'll know he's gone the same way I knew about Abby. I have a tap on the personnel roster.
Set your TranScribe to record:
Now get into Deep Storage. Probably the only safe place on the station.
Me... I'm going to see what good I can do out here.
Dialog.notes: Not very hopeful.

Dialog.text: What the...?
My O2 levels must be failing. I'm hallucinating.
Dialog.notes: To herself, not comical, but a little scared

Dialog.text: What did you just do?
Hey, guys. Sorry I'm late. Stationwide OS upgrade, had to hold Bellamy's hand through the whole process. Abby, do you have my character sheet?

Dialog.notes: Synthesized voice of Danielle reading back voice lock key
Synthesized voice of Danielle reading back voice lock key
Synthesized voice of Danielle reading back voice lock key
Synthesized voice of Danielle reading back voice lock key
Synthesized voice of Danielle reading back voice lock key
Synthesized voice of Danielle reading back voice lock key
Synthesized voice of Danielle reading back voice lock key
Synthesized voice of Danielle reading back voice lock key
Synthesized voice of Danielle reading back voice lock key
Synthesized voice of Danielle reading back voice lock key
Synthesized voice of Danielle reading back voice lock key

Dialog.text: You assholes will bury it with your psych eval bullshit. And another thing-
Abby, I'm so sorry. About everything.
Dialog.notes: Quiet, dying.

Dialog.text: I... should have told you about what happened at TranStar Boston, about Jessica, I should have... let the Yu family go.
Morgan, Alex... it wasn't worth it.

Dialog.notes: Recalls that Morgan was there at the end. Laughs.

Dialog.text: [music playing]
Dialog.notes: danielle's song plays here

Dialog.text: I can't believe you got modded for Alex's clown show at the Tulip.
Only to catch you if you suddenly collapse. And only if you keep me from punching Alex if I drink too much.
Dialog.notes: Hmph. Only doing this for you, don't get mushy.

Dialog.text: She showed up. She never left the station. She tried to help... I think she was always trying to... but...
I hope she fixes the station. Helps the crew. And not for TranStar - not for science. I hope...
Dialog.notes: Quieter for last 2 sentences.

Dialog.text: ...she caught your killer... proves there's a little justice.
I hope... she makes it out alive... not so she's punished.
Dialog.notes: O2 starts cutting out.

Dialog.text: It's because I don't want her joining us just yet, Abby. We didn't have enough time. The two of us.
Dialog.notes: Quieter. Flatlines.

Dialog.text: He showed up. He never left the station. He tried to help... I think he was always trying to... but...
I hope he fixes the station. Helps the crew. And not for TranStar - not for science. I hope...
Dialog.notes: Quieter for last 2 sentences.

Dialog.text: ...he caught your killer... proves there's a little justice.
I hope... he makes it out alive... not so he's punished.
It's because I don't want him joining us just yet, Abby. We didn't have enough time. The two of us.
Dialog.notes: Quieter. Flatlines.

Dialog.text: Morgan? Alex has you boxed in.
Dialog.notes: Labored breathing.

Dialog.text: Look, there's nothing I can do about the lockdown from out here, but I promised I'd help you, so listen.
Deep Storage was built with a series of Data Vault Modules that can be jettisoned from the station.
It's a redundant backup system.
That's your way out.
Look at my workstation again. I'm exposing a utility that'll open up one of the vaults.
Once you're in, look for a manual release.
Then your ass is space junk, like me.
Also... I stashed some supplies. They were supposed to be for me and Abby, but... you can have them.
And if you manage to get back inside remember, you owe me. Kill the sonofabitch who hurt Abby or I swear to God I'll haunt you.
Dialog.notes: Labored breathing.

Dialog.text: Morgan? You're shitting me. I knew someone was messing with my workstation but... God.
Look... I'm going to do you a favor since you killed the sonofabitch that hurt Abby.
Dialog.notes: Labored breathing.

Dialog.text: Maybe you don't know what I'm talking about but I am NOT dying while I owe you something, so listen.
There. Even.
Dialog.notes: Slowed breathing.

Dialog.text: Morgan? This is Chief Sho. I'm not dead. Not yet.
Dialog.notes: Labored breathing.

Dialog.text: I know you spoofed my voice to get in there. And now you're stuck. Some family.
I'm going to help you, but you have to do something for me.
Someone posing as the cook - killed Abby. Abigail Foy. Ran Sanitation. You wouldn't know her... but she was... (swallows)
Dialog.notes: Struggling a little with the emotion and dwindling air.

Dialog.text: He's still here. He can't have gotten out. Want to do one good thing? Just one. Find him. Kill him.
Look at my workstation again. I'm exposing a utility that'll open a Data Vault Module.
It's a redundant backup system that's meant to be jettisoned from the station.
Morgan. If you get back inside... Please, fix this station. Not for science, not for the future - do it for the crew. Please.
I'm going to tap into the roster servers to see if I can find you guys.
If things get bad, I'll jettison a data vault and spacewalk along the hull. Come to the Fitness Center and bang on the window by the pool. I should feel the vibration.
So - I found your sticky note. The one under the desk. With your password.
Look, you need to keep your password safe, all right? I'm watching out for you because I love you.
Dialog.notes: Starts stern.

Dialog.text: I loved you enough to crawl under your desk. I totally wasn't looking for the pen I dropped.
Dialog.notes: Beat after first sentence.

Dialog.text: Morgan? It's Danielle... look, I think I have an idea. It's risky... but it might get the main lift and the external airlocks working again.
Dialog.notes: [RICARDO SCRIPT]

Dialog.text: You'll need to get to the main reactor control and - shut off power to the station. If I recall the specs right... the reactor should reboot not long after.
Dialog.notes: Pauses at the hyphen, this is a crazy plan. At end, emphasis on SHOULD to reinforce doubt.

Dialog.text: If - when - it does, the lift and airlock controls will reset.
I don't know if giving you free run of the station will add more fuel to the fire, but if this helps anyone else escape... it's worth it.
Dialog.notes: If the player is an asshole/psychopath. Under her breath, emphasis on YOU. Slight accusing, doesn't like/trust Morgan.

Dialog.text: It's too late for me - but it may help you save others.
Dialog.notes: Optional, if Danielle is sympathetic to Morgan/Morgan's not a psycho.

Dialog.text: Make sure he doesn't get away. Get to Deep Storage... I'll try to help you from out here.
It never saw me.
It killed Volunteer 37, but it's hard to say why.
And it never ran into Volunteer 37. Hard to say what it would have done.
There were a lot of humans controlled by the Typhon that it could have harmed. Seems like it went out of its way to avoid that.
A lot of humans controlled by the Typhon ended up dead. Not that it was easy to avoid but...
I just don't think it's worth the risk.
I think it's worth the risk.
It found me. It didn't need to, but it did.
I asked it to stop Volunteer 37. That was dangerous. No way to be sure, but I think it has a sense of retribution.
I asked it to stop Volunteer 37, but it left him alive. It could mean a low drive for retribution.
By then, it had already stopped volunteer 37. Hard to say why.
You're assuming it thinks like us.
If you're here... then Abby didn't make it, did she? I-
Dialog.notes: Emotional. End line is cut off but she means, "I had hoped."

Dialog.text: I can help... I know you need to get into Deep Storage. I voice-locked it, but I have the override that bypasses the random word input.
Alex. Oedipus Complex. Pompous. Nepotist.
No offense to your brother - but that should be enough.
Dialog.notes: Sarcasm at front.

Dialog.text: But watch your step... there's someone else in Crew Quarters, pretending to be the Cook. His tracking bracelet's from Psychotronics, but... the ID doesn't make any sense.
Dialog.notes: Warning, then slightly confused at end. Beat before "the ID."

Dialog.text: He... I think he's the one that killed Abby.
If you can, make sure he doesn't get off the station.
I'll see what else I can do to help from out here. (O2 Warning) For as long as I can.
Dialog.notes: O2 warning should be a SFX that interrupts, like a beat.

Dialog.text: There was someone else in Crew Quarters, pretending to be the Cook. His tracking bracelet was from Psychotronics but... the ID didn't make any sense.
Dialog.notes: Emphasis on "WAS." Slightly confused at the end, wasn't sure who this person really was.

Dialog.text: He... killed Abby.
Dialog.notes: Death of ex-lover sinks in again.

Dialog.text: I'm guessing you're the reason his bracelet went red. I owe you one. And so does Abby.
Dialog.notes: A little quieter, thankful to Morgan. Beat before "I owe you one."

Dialog.text: Look, no need to stand here - get moving, I'll keep the TranScribe open, you need to get to Deep Storage. Problem is, the lock...
Dialog.notes: Resets, focuses on mission. About to explain a quest solution, but player already figured it out.

Dialog.text: ...wait - that's why you knew where I was. You were scrounging TranScribes, trying to find samples to bypass the voice lock. Hnh.
Dialog.notes: Realization, then impressed, despite herself. Beat after Wait.

Dialog.text: Nothing more that I can do for you right now... but... look, be careful. There's someone else in Crew Quarters, pretending to be the Cook.
Dialog.notes: Takes a breath. Confused at the end, doesn't know who this person was.

Dialog.text: His tracking bracelet's from Psychotronics, but... the ID doesn't make any sense.
Nothing more I can do for you right now... except...
Dialog.notes: Oh, well.

Dialog.text: ...there was someone else in Crew Quarters, pretending to be the Cook.
Dialog.notes: Another dawning realization. Emphasis on "WAS." Slightly confused at the end, wasn't sure who this person really was.

Dialog.text: ...wanted to check on you, Skye.
Dialog.notes: Slight concern, Skye just got modded.

Dialog.text: Can't believe you're making me watch this.
Dialog.notes: Grumbling under her breath in theater, checking texts.

Dialog.text: Just a sec...
Dammit! (TS Clatters to floor.) It's under the seat.
Do you know how many security protocols you broke?
Dialog.notes: Shaking head.

Dialog.text: I stashed some supplies in Deep Storage. They were supposed to be for me and Abby, but... you can have them. I'll send the code.
Dialog.notes: Maybe you can put them to use.

Dialog.text: I'm sending you the code to the reactor room.

Dialog.notes: None of your business Dr. Khol

Dialog.text: Maybe you don't know what I'm talking about but I am NOT dying while I owe you something, so listen.
Dialog.notes: Female Branch, Localization
